DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Mode [RM]
    Report Fan Speed [RFS]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the thermostat to 22 degrees Celsius and switch it to heat mode with medium fan speed?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The thermostat accepts a target temperature between 10.0 and 30.0 °C, modes include Off, Heat, Cool, and Auto, and fan speeds are Low, Medium, and High. The commands to use are Set Target Temperature (STT) with a float parameter, Set Mode (SM) with an enum parameter, and Set Fan Speed (SFS) with an enum parameter.

To fulfill the request:
1. Use STT with parameter 22.0 to set the target temperature to 22 °C.
2. Use SM with parameter Heat (1) to switch to heat mode.
3. Use SFS with parameter Medium (1) to set the fan speed to medium.

Result: Execute STT(22.0), SM(Heat), and SFS(Medium) commands to configure the thermostat as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Kitchen Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit level
        Off [0]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit level
    Set Direction [SD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Forward [0]
          Reverse [1]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power [RP]
    Report Speed [RS]
    Report Direction [RD]

USER QUERY:
I want to turn on the kitchen fan, set its speed to 3, and reverse the direction. How do I do that?

I analyze the device structure: the fan has a power status (On/Off), speed levels from 0 to 5 (0 means Off), and direction can be Forward or Reverse. The accepted commands are Turn On (ON), Turn Off (OFF), Set Speed (SS) with a level parameter, and Set Direction (SD) with an enum parameter.

To meet the request:
1. Use Turn On (ON) to power the fan on.
2. Use Set Speed (SS) with parameter 3 to set the speed level to 3.
3. Use Set Direction (SD) with parameter Reverse (1) to reverse the fan direction.

Result: Send ON, SS(3), and SD(Reverse) commands to turn on the fan, set speed to 3, and reverse direction.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

  ***Send Commands***

    Report Color Temperature [RCT]

USER QUERY:
Could you turn on the bedroom light at 75% brightness and set the color temperature to 3000 Kelvin?

Reviewing the device structure, the bedroom smart light has properties for Status (0-100%), Color Temperature (2700-6500 K), and Brightness (0-100%). The commands to turn on the light with a brightness level is On (DON) with a parameter 0-100%, and to set color temperature is Set Color Temperature (SCT) with a parameter 2700-6500 K.

To fulfill the request:
1. Use DON with parameter 75 to turn on the light at 75% brightness.
2. Use SCT with parameter 3000 to set the color temperature to 3000 K.

Result: Execute DON(75) and SCT(3000) commands to turn on the bedroom light at 75% brightness and set color temperature to 3000 K.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [UD]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Door Status [RDS]
    Report Lock Status [RLS]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door currently open, and can you lock it if it's unlocked?

First, I check the device properties: Door Status can be Closed, Open, Opening, or Closing; Lock Status can be Locked or Unlocked. The commands to control the door are Open Door, Close Door, Lock Door, and Unlock Door.

To answer if the door is open, I would query the Door Status property. If it is Open (1), then the door is open.

If the door is unlocked (Lock Status = Unlocked [1]), I can send the Lock Door (LD) command to lock it.

Result: Query the door status. If it is open, confirm that. Then check lock status; if unlocked, send LD command to lock the door.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Outdoor Sprinkler System
  ***Properties***
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit L/min
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [SZ]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 5 Unit zone
    Stop Zone [SPZ]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 5 Unit zone
    Enable Schedule [ES]
    Disable Schedule [DS]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Flow Rate [RFR]
    Report Zone Status [RZS]
    Report Schedule Status [RSS]

USER QUERY:
Please start zone 3 of the sprinkler and enable the watering schedule. Also, what is the current water flow rate?

Analyzing the device structure, the sprinkler system has properties for Water Flow Rate (0-20 L/min), Zone Status (On/Off), and Schedule Enabled (True/False). Commands include Start Zone (SZ) and Stop Zone (SPZ) with zone number parameters 1-5, Enable Schedule (ES), Disable Schedule (DS), and Query Status (QS).

To fulfill the request:
1. Use SZ with parameter 3 to start zone 3.
2. Use ES to enable the watering schedule.
3. Query the current water flow rate property.

Result: Send SZ(3) and ES commands to start zone 3 and enable schedule, then query Water Flow Rate to report the current flow in L/min.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power Usage
      Range 0 to 10000 Unit W
    Total Energy Consumed
      Range 0 to 100000 Unit kWh
    Voltage
      Range 100 to 240 Unit V
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy Counter [REC]
    Query Current Power [QCP]
    Query Total Energy [QTE]
    Query Voltage [QV]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power Usage [RPU]
    Report Energy Consumed [REC]
    Report Voltage [RV]

USER QUERY:
What is the current power usage and voltage? Also, how do I reset the total energy consumed counter?

Reviewing the device structure, the Smart Energy Meter has properties for Current Power Usage (0-10000 W), Total Energy Consumed (0-100000 kWh), and Voltage (100-240 V). Commands include queries for current power, total energy, and voltage, plus a Reset Energy Counter command.

To answer the query:
1. Use Query Current Power (QCP) to get the current power usage in watts.
2. Use Query Voltage (QV) to get the current voltage in volts.
3. To reset the total energy consumed counter, use the Reset Energy Counter (REC) command.

Result: Execute QCP and QV to report current power usage and voltage, then send REC to reset the energy counter.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the bathroom fan at speed level 2 and set a timer for 30 minutes?

Examining the device structure, the bathroom exhaust fan has properties Status (On/Off), Speed (0-3 levels), and Timer (0-120 minutes). Commands include Turn On, Turn Off, Set Speed with a level parameter, and Set Timer with minutes parameter.

To fulfill the request:
1. Use Turn On (ON) to power the fan on.
2. Use Set Speed (SS) with parameter 2 to set speed level to 2.
3. Use Set Timer (ST) with parameter 30 to set the timer for 30 minutes.

Result: Send ON, SS(2), and ST(30) commands to turn on the fan at speed 2 and set a 30-minute timer.

USER QUERY:
Please open the office blinds halfway and tilt the slats to 30 degrees upward.

Reviewing the device structure, the office window blind has Position property from 0% (closed) to 100% (open), and Tilt Angle from -90 to 90 degrees. Commands include Set Position with a percentage parameter, Set Tilt with degrees parameter, Open, and Close.

To meet the request:
1. Use Set Position (SP) with parameter 50 to open the blinds halfway.
2. Use Set Tilt (ST) with parameter 30 to tilt the slats 30 degrees upward.

Result: Send SP(50) and ST(30) commands to open the blinds halfway and tilt slats 30 degrees upward.

  ***Properties***

      Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Ice Maker Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [ST]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Turn Ice Maker On [IMON]
    Turn Ice Maker Off [IMOFF]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Door Status [RDS]
    Report Ice Maker Status [RIMS]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the refrigerator temperature to 4 degrees Celsius and turn the ice maker on?

Analyzing the device structure, the refrigerator has Internal Temperature property ranging from 1 to 10 °C, Door Status (Open/Closed), and Ice Maker Status (On/Off). Commands include Set Temperature (ST) with a temperature parameter, and commands to turn the ice maker on or off.

To fulfill the request:
1. Use Set Temperature (ST) with parameter 4 to set the internal temperature to 4 °C.
2. Use Turn Ice Maker On (IMON) to activate the ice maker.

Result: Send ST(4) and IMON commands to set temperature to 4 °C and turn the ice maker on.
